Class Raytracer.Vector3

  • java.lang.Object
    • Raytracer.JSONSerializable
      • Raytracer.Vector3
  • Enclosing class:
    Raytracer

    class Raytracer.Vector3
extends Raytracer.JSONSerializable
    Represents a 3D Vector. Can be used to represent a point in 3D space, a direction (as a unit vector), or an RGB color.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private boolean isNormalized  
      float x  
      float y  
      float z  

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Vector3​()
      Constructs a 3D zero vector.
      Vector3​(float x, float y, float z)
      Constructs a 3D vector from x, y, and z components.
      Vector3​(int colour)
      Converts a Processing color primitive to a Vector3.
      Vector3​(JSONObject j)
      Constructs a Vector3 object from the values in the JSONObject (JSON deserialization).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      float dot​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
      Returns the dot product of this vector with the other vector.
      float dotSelf​()
      Returns the dot product of this vector with itself.

      Returns the magnitude of this vector.
      float getMagnitudeSquared​()
      Returns the square of the magnitude of this vector.
      Raytracer.Vector3 hadamardTimes​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
      Returns a new vector with the componentwise product of this vector with the other vector, also known as the Hadamard product.
      Raytracer.Vector3 minus​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
      Returns a new vector representing the other vector subtracted from this vector.
      Raytracer.Vector3 normalize​()
      Normalizes this vector.
      Raytracer.Vector3 plus​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
      Returns a new vector representing the sum of this vector and the other vector.
      Raytracer.Vector3 times​(float scalar)
      Returns a new vector representing this vector multiplied by a scalar.
      int toColorPrimitive​()
      Converts this Vector to a Processing color primitive.

      Serializes this object into a JSONObject.

      Generates a human-friendly String representation of this vector for debugging purposes.

      • toJSONObject

        public JSONObject toJSONObject​()
        Description copied from class: Raytracer.JSONSerializable
        Serializes this object into a JSONObject. Stores the name of this class into the "type" entry of the JSONObject. Subclasses should override this method, call super.toJSONObject() to get a JSONObject, and then store all their necessary data into that.
        Overrides:
        toJSONObject in class Raytracer.JSONSerializable
        Returns:
        the JSONObject containing this object's data.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Generates a human-friendly String representation of this vector for debugging purposes.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toColorPrimitive

        public int toColorPrimitive​()
        Converts this Vector to a Processing color primitive.

      • getMagnitude

        public float getMagnitude​()
        Returns the magnitude of this vector.

      • getMagnitudeSquared

        public float getMagnitudeSquared​()
        Returns the square of the magnitude of this vector. This is more efficient than getMagnitude() if only the squared magnitude is needed.

      • normalize

        public Raytracer.Vector3 normalize​()
        Normalizes this vector. Returns itself so that it can be chained with other operators.
        Returns:
        this.

      • plus

        public Raytracer.Vector3 plus​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
        Returns a new vector representing the sum of this vector and the other vector.

      • minus

        public Raytracer.Vector3 minus​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
        Returns a new vector representing the other vector subtracted from this vector.

      • times

        public Raytracer.Vector3 times​(float scalar)
        Returns a new vector representing this vector multiplied by a scalar.

      • hadamardTimes

        public Raytracer.Vector3 hadamardTimes​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
        Returns a new vector with the componentwise product of this vector with the other vector, also known as the Hadamard product. We use it when multiplying a light's color by an object's albedo to compute how much of each color (in RGB) is reflected.

      • dot

        public float dot​(Raytracer.Vector3 other)
        Returns the dot product of this vector with the other vector.

      • dotSelf

        public float dotSelf​()
        Returns the dot product of this vector with itself. Slightly faster when dealing with normalized (unit) vectors.
